content.description: Two 99 percent confidence intervals will be constructed to estimate the difference in means of two populations, R and W. One confidence interval, <math alttext="I sub 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, will be constructed using samples of size 9 from each of R and W, and the other confidence interval, <math alttext="I sub 81" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>81</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, will be constructed using samples of size 81 from each of R and W.
content.question: When all other things remain the same, which of the following describes the relationship between the two confidence intervals?

choices.label: The width of <math alttext="I sub 81" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>81</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> will be <math alttext="one ninth" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> the width of <math alttext="I sub 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The width of <math alttext="I sub 81" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>81</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> will be <math alttext="one third " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> the width of <math alttext="I sub 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The width of <math alttext="I sub 81" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>81</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> will be equal to the width of <math alttext="I sub 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The width of <math alttext="I sub 81" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>81</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> will be 3 times the width of <math alttext="I sub 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The width of <math alttext="I sub 81" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>81</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> will be 9 times the width of <math alttext="I sub 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The width of <math alttext="I sub 81" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>81</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> will be <math alttext="one third " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> the width of <math alttext="I sub 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 7.7: Justifying a Claim About the Difference of Two Means Based on a Confidence Interval

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Make an appropriate claim or draw an appropriate conclusion.
